Search For POGs

Search for Putative Orthologous Groups (POGs) containing genes in Arabidopsis thaliana, Zea mays, Oryza sativa, and/or Populus trichocarpa that meet the following criteria:

*Primary orthology prediction method. Request Additional Orthology Predictions

Keywords from Gene Descriptions, Domain names, Interpro IDs. Guidelines for Boolean Searches
Limit Search By Predicted or Established Intracellular Location of Gene Product

All Intracellular Filters Are AND boolean searches.

Description


POGs 2.0, is a relational database designed to facilitate cross-species inferences about gene functions and gene models in plants. The database integrates data from rice (Orza sativa), maize (Zea mays), Arabidopsis thaliana, and Poplar (Populus trichocarpa) by placing the complete predicted proteomes into "putative orthologous groups" (POGs). POGs were imported from Grameneâ€™s ENSEMBL orthology prediction output and from Plaza (OrthoMCL-calculated orthologous groups).

Each POG entry includes putative orthologs annotated with gene descriptions imported from species-specific databases, graphical representations of conserved protein domains, phylogenetic trees showing closely-related proteins, intracellular targeting predictions and verified targeting data from PPDB. The database can be queried by Interpro domain keyword or ID, genemodel or transcript accessions, known or predicted intracellular location, or any combination of the above.

Development of this database was funded by grant IOS- 0922560 from the National Science Foundation.
